newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-DYNAMO, ROTOR RETAIN LEAD OVER SPARTAK.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DYNAMO, ROTOR RETAIN LEAD OVER SPARTAK.

text.p: Dynamo Moscow and Rotor Volgograd both held onto a two-point lead over Spartak Moscow in the Russian league on Saturday after all three teams scored important victories.

Spartak thrashed bottom of the table Kamaz Naberezhnye Chelny 6-2 in Moscow as six different players scored for the defending champions. But they still trail Rotor and Dynamo, both on 46 points, although the Muscovites have a game in hand.
Rotor edged out Baltika Kaliningrad 2-1 at home thanks to an 89th minute goal by Alexander Berketov, while Dynamo beat cross-town rivals Lokomotiv 3-1 despite trailing for most of the game.
The rail-road club surged ahead on Dmitry Loskov's strike in the 34th minute but gave up three goals with less than 12 minutes remaining.
In another Moscow derby, Torpedo scored an impressive 3-0 win over CSKA to remain in fourth place with 40 points after 23 matches.
